searchHelp.body:
SyntaxExampleMeaning
orig:orig:ZNYOrigin ARTCC/airport
dest:dest:KATLDestination ARTCC/airport
thru:thru:ZOBTraverses ARTCC
- (NOT)-thru:ZKCExcludes routes traversing ZKC
space (AND)orig:ZNY dest:ZTLBoth conditions must match
, (OR)orig:ZNY,ZDCEither origin matches
textBUMName or route contains text
searchHelp.title: Search Syntax

playbook.searchPlaceholder: Search... (orig: dest: thru: | OR: , AND: space NOT: -)

playbook.selectPlayPrompt: Select a play from the list to view details and routes
playbook.title: Playbook

privacy.changesText: vATCSCC must ensure to notify all members affected of any changes to this policy. All information collected prior to the date of a new policy are subject to the old policy's material, and can not be changed in any way of share without proper consent.
privacy.collectionIntro: Information collected by the vATCSCC, and responsible to the facility through the VATSIM Data Protection & Handling Policy, and are displayed through this site in any matter, includes the following:
privacy.collectionItem1: Personal details as collected by VATSIM, and stored in our secure databases, which include your first, last, and in some scenarios: your middle name, and is dependent on the data that you have inputted into the vatsim.net services.
privacy.collectionItem2: Details in regards to your VATSIM-specific "controller" identifier (CID) which is automatically generated through the vatsim.net services, and obtained by vATCSCC through the VATSIM Connect system.
privacy.collectionRemoval: You, as a user of this website, under authority of vATCSCC, and a member under the VATSIM Network (vatsim.net); through the services of VATSIM, have the ability to request the removal of your data. To request your data be removed upon approval from VATSIM; through this website, you must contact vatusa9@vatusa.net (CC: vatusa14@vatusa.net).
privacy.cookiesText: vATCSCC utilizes "cookies" that are stored through the user's hard drives, and are related to the client to store data relevant to each session that is created through the website. These cookies will allow you to view certain pages and functions not accessible to the general user.
privacy.registrationText: In order to use our services, you must be a registered and active VATSIM member. By logging into our services via the VATSIM Connent oAuth system, VATSIM provides information to vATCSCC for use on our website. When logging in via Connect, the information which is provided to our services is explicitly detailed and you must consent to this information being shared with us prior to logging in. Some parts of our systems are accessible without registration or authentication. Despite not being required to log in to these services with personal credentials, data will be logged. Data includes cookies, IP addresses, and other data which may result in you being identifiable. If you wish to utilize our services while retaining anonymity, this is possible by taking appropriate anonymisation measures within your browser's settings.
privacy.securityText: vATCSCC does not store passwords, and will not ask for passwords pertaining directly to our party. Our party will ensure that all data is properly secured, and these systems are protected and only granted authorization through explicitly granted access from permissions through the website, and the database.
privacy.sharingIntro: The information collected by vATCSCC may be shared with the following parties:
privacy.thirdPartyText: vATCSCC does, and will display links that may or not be affiliated with our party, and as such are not responsible for the privacy policies and policies of each 3rd-party website. Our party encourages members to read these policies before proceeding to utilize the sites.
privacy.title: Privacy Policy

page.areasDescription: Areas are pre-defined groups of sectors (e.g., "ZNY A" = ZNY07+ZNY08+ZNY09...). They can be used for quick sector selection when creating splits.
page.helpActiveNow: Active splits appear in the "Active Now" tab and on the floating panel.
page.helpAreas: Areas are named sector groupings used to organize split configurations.
page.helpClickSector: Click on any sector on the map to see details and assign it to positions.
page.helpMapLayers: Use the Map Layers panel (top-right of map) to toggle visibility of different layer types.
page.helpNewConfig: Click + New Config to create an active split configuration with positions and sectors.
page.helpPresets: Presets are reusable split templates you can create and save for quick access.
page.helpShowOnMap: Use the "Show on Map" section to preview presets/areas without activating them.
page.loadPresetHint: Load positions from a saved preset template, then customize as needed.

page.presetInfo: Presets are reusable position templates without time constraints. Define your positions once, then quickly load them into new configurations whenever needed.
page.publishHint: When published, this configuration will be visible to all users and shown on the active splits map.
page.savePresetHint: Save the current positions as a reusable template for future configurations.
page.sectorInputHint: Enter sector numbers separated by commas. Use just numbers (50,51) to auto-prefix with ARTCC.
page.selectAreaPrompt: Select an area to edit or click "+ New Area" to create one.
page.selectAreaTip: Tip: Use "Select on Map" when editing to click sectors directly on the map!
page.selectPositionPrompt: Select a position from the left to assign sectors,
page.selectPositionPromptHint: or click "+ Add Position" to create one.
page.selectSplitPrompt: Select a split from the left to assign sectors.
page.subtitle: Configure airspace sector groupings

docs.releaseDocsDesc: Release notes, deployment guide, and configuration reference.

keys.aboutSwimApiDesc: VATSWIM provides real-time flight data, positions, and traffic management information across the VATSIM network.
keys.authHeader: Include your API key in the Authorization header:
keys.keyCreatedWarning: Copy this key now. For security reasons, it will not be displayed again.
keys.loginMessage: You must be logged in with your VATSIM account to create and manage SWIM API keys.
keys.noKeys: You don't have any API keys yet. Create one above to get started.
keys.pageDesc: Manage your API credentials for accessing the VATSWIM (System Wide Information Management) data feed.
keys.subtitle: Manage Your API Credentials
keys.tierFooter: Partner and System tiers require approval. Contact us for access.
keys.title: SWIM API Keys

page.accessTiersDesc: Choose the tier that fits your needs. Public and Developer keys are available instantly.
page.apiEndpointsDesc: Complete REST API for querying flight data and ingesting updates.
page.apiKeyPortalDesc: Create and manage your API keys
atcCapabilities: Monitor sector traffic loads in real-time
Track TMI-controlled flights and EDCT compliance
Access demand forecasts for arrival/departure planning
Push track data from radar simulation (System tier)
page.ctaDesc: Create your API key in seconds and start integrating real-time VATSIM flight data today.
devCapabilities: Create statistics dashboards and analytics tools
Integrate live flight data into existing software
page.flightEndpoint: Get single flight by GUFI, flight_uid, or flight_key
page.flightsEndpoint: List flights with filtering by airport, ARTCC, callsign, phase, and TMI status
page.geoJsonDesc: Position data ready for MapLibre, Leaflet, or Mapbox rendering.
page.gettingStartedDesc: Start integrating with SWIM in three steps.
page.ingestAdlEndpoint: Ingest flight data (OOOI times, ETAs) — Partner+ tier
page.interactiveDocsDesc: Swagger UI with Try It Out
pilotCapabilities: Look up any active flight on VATSIM
Check if your flight is affected by ground stops
page.positionsEndpoint: Bulk flight positions in GeoJSON FeatureCollection format
page.resourcesDesc: Everything you need to get started with SWIM.
page.restApiDesc: Query flights, positions, and TMI data with filtering and pagination.
page.step1Desc: Log in with your VATSIM account at the API Key Portal to create a key instantly.
page.step2Desc: Include your API key in the Authorization header:
page.step3Desc: Read the full documentation to discover all endpoints, filters, and WebSocket events.

page.title: VATSWIM API
page.tmiControlledEndpoint: Flights under TMI control with EDCT/slot assignments
page.tmiDataDesc: Ground Stops, GDPs, EDCTs, and controlled flight information.
page.useCasesByRoleDesc: SWIM serves different needs across the VATSIM ecosystem.
vaCapabilities: Push OOOI times from ACARS/AOC systems
Receive TMI notifications affecting your flights
Export flight data for on-time performance analysis
Integrate schedule data (STD/STA) per CDM specs
page.webSocketDesc: Real-time event streaming for departures, arrivals, and position updates.
page.whatIsSwimDesc: A centralized real-time data exchange hub for flight information across the VATSIM network.

transparency.costOptNote: We deliberately avoid over-provisioning. Our philosophy is to scale reactively based on actual demand rather than paying for unused capacity.
transparency.costsIntro: PERTI operates on Microsoft Azure infrastructure across the Central US and East US regions. Below is a transparent breakdown of our actual operational costs, sourced directly from Azure Cost Management.
transparency.hyperscaleNote: VATSIM_ADL is the primary cost driver at ~92% of total spend. It runs Hyperscale Serverless Gen5 with 16 vCores max, 3 vCores min, auto-pause disabled, and 1 HA replica. Compute scales based on query load from 14 background daemons processing flight data every 15 seconds.
transparency.scalingStrategyDesc: Our infrastructure uses Azure Hyperscale Serverless databases that automatically scale with demand. The App Service layer can be scaled independently.
transparency.subtitle: Open disclosure of PERTI's operational costs and scaling strategy
transparency.title: Infrastructure Transparency
